Commands

Class Iteration

  • java.lang.Object
    • Commands.Iteration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class Iteration
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command
    A class representing while-command: these consist of a condition, and a command to execute as long as the conditions holds.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Brecht Gosselé & William Mauclet 2BiR: wtk-cws (Gosselé) en cws-elt(Mauclet)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Iteration(Condition condition, Command command)
      A new iteration is created, with the given condition and command.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsNextStep(Robot robot, int lastStep)
      Returns whether this command contains a BasicCommand the given robot has not yet executed, and can execute.
      void execute(Robot robot)
      Executes this iteration.
      void executeStep(Robot robot, int nextStep)
      Executes the BasicCommand indicated by the parameter nextStep.
      int getNbBasicCommands()
      Returns the number of basic commands in this iteration.
      int getStepNbOfNextStep(Robot robot, int lastStep)
      Returns the step number of the next BasicCommand the robot can execute in this iteration.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this iteration.

      • Iteration

        public Iteration(Condition condition,
         Command command)
        A new iteration is created, with the given condition and command.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition of this new iteration.
        command - The command of this new iteration.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(Robot robot)
        Executes this iteration.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that has to execute this command.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this iteration.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Command
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of this iteration, consisting of the word "while", followed by the respective string representations of the condition and the command, and the whole enclosed by brackets.

      • getNbBasicCommands

        public int getNbBasicCommands()
        Returns the number of basic commands in this iteration.
        Specified by:
        getNbBasicCommands in interface Command
        Returns:
        An integer, namely the result of the getNbBasicCommands()-method of this iteration's command.

      • containsNextStep

        public boolean containsNextStep(Robot robot,
                       int lastStep)
        Returns whether this command contains a BasicCommand the given robot has not yet executed, and can execute.
        Specified by:
        containsNextStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to check if it can execute a basic command in this iteration.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this iteration.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean true if this iteration contains a next BasicCommand the given Robot can execute in view of the last step the robot has executed of this iteration, and the state of the robot itself. Returns a boolean false if this is not the case.

      • getStepNbOfNextStep

        public int getStepNbOfNextStep(Robot robot,
                      int lastStep)
        Returns the step number of the next BasicCommand the robot can execute in this iteration.
        Specified by:
        getStepNbOfNextStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to look up the next basic command it can execute in this iteration.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this iteration.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating the stepNb of the next executable BasicCommand in this command for the given robot. This will depend on the last step the robot has executed of this iteration, and on the state of the robot itself.

      • executeStep

        public void executeStep(Robot robot,
               int nextStep)
        Executes the BasicCommand indicated by the parameter nextStep.
        Specified by:
        executeStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that should execute a step of this iteration.
        nextStep - An integer defining unambiguously which basic command the robot has to execute of this iteration.
